leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: PART 2 WORDS AND EXPRESSIONS [ss 6–21C]
[330,070] s 6 Definitions to be read in context

leg:heading.title: Definitions to be read in context

p.text: Definitions that occur in an Act or instrument apply to the construction of the Act or instrument except in so far as the context or subject-matter otherwise indicates or requires.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,075] s 7 Cognate words

p.text: If an Act or instrument defines a word or expression, other parts of speech and grammatical forms of the word or expression have corresponding meanings.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,080] s 8 Gender and number

p.text: In any Act or instrument:
a word or expression that indicates one or more particular genders shall be taken to indicate every other gender,
a reference to a word or expression in the singular form includes a reference to the word or expression in the plural form,
a reference to a word or expression in the plural form includes a reference to the word or expression in the singular form,

a reference to a person does not exclude a reference to a corporation merely because elsewhere in the Act or instrument there is particular reference to a corporation (in whatever terms expressed), and
reference to a person does not exclude a reference to an individual merely because elsewhere in the Act or instrument there is particular reference to an individual (in whatever terms expressed).

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,085] s 9 Meaning of may and shall

p.text: In any Act or instrument, the word “may”, if used to confer a power, indicates that the power may be exercised or not, at discretion.
In any Act or instrument, the word “shall”, if used to impose a duty, indicates that the duty must be performed.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,090] s 10 Construction of amending Acts and instruments

leg:heading.title: Construction of amending Acts and instruments

p.text: Words and expressions that occur in an Act or instrument that amends or repeals some other Act or instrument have the same meanings as they have in the other Act or instrument.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,095] s 11 Words etc in instruments under an Act have same meanings as in the Act

leg:heading.title: Words etc in instruments under an Act have same meanings as in the Act

p.text: Words and expressions that occur in an instrument have the same meanings as they have in the Act, or in the relevant provisions of the Act, under which the instrument is made.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,100] s 12 References to New South Wales to be implied

leg:heading.title: References to New South Wales to be implied

p.text: In any Act or instrument:
a reference to an officer, office or statutory body is a reference to such an officer, office or statutory body in and for New South Wales, and
a reference to a locality, jurisdiction or other matter or thing is a reference to such a locality, jurisdiction or other matter or thing in and of New South Wales.

In any Act or instrument, a reference to a body constituted by or under an Act or instrument need not include the words “New South Wales” or “of New South Wales” merely because those words form part of the body's name or title.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,105] s 13 Sovereign and Crown

p.text: In any Act or instrument:
a reference to the Sovereign (whether the words “Her Majesty” or “His Majesty” or any other words are used) is a reference to the Sovereign for the time being, and
a reference to the Crown is a reference to the Crown in right of New South Wales.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,107] s 13A NSW Government agencies and statutory bodies representing the Crown

leg:heading.title: NSW Government agencies and statutory bodies representing the Crown

p.text: If an Act provides that a body is:
a NSW Government agency, or
a statutory body representing the Crown,
the body has the status, privileges and immunities of the Crown.
If an Act provides that a body:
is not or does not represent the Crown, or
is not a NSW Government agency or a statutory body representing the Crown,
the body does not have the status, privileges and immunities of the Crown.
This section extends (without limiting its operation):
to a provision that is expressed to be made for the purposes of any Act or more generally, and
to privileges and immunities conferred by law expressly or as a matter of construction.
In any Act or instrument:
a reference to a NSW Government agency includes a reference to a body that is declared to be a statutory body representing the Crown, or
a reference to a statutory body representing the Crown includes a reference to a body that is declared to be a NSW Government agency.
In this section, the Crown includes the State and the Government of the State.
[s 13A insrt Act 43 of 2006 s 3 and Sch 1[1], effective 8 June 2006]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,110] s 14 Governor

p.text: In any Act or instrument, a reference to the Governor is a reference to the Governor with the advice of the Executive Council, and includes a reference to any person for the time being lawfully administering the Government.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,115] s 15 Minister

p.text: In any Act or instrument:
a reference to a Minister is a reference to a Minister of the Crown, and
a reference to a particular Minister includes a reference to any other Minister who is acting for or on behalf of the Minister.
In any Act, a reference to “the Minister” is a reference to:
the Minister administering the Act,
if different Ministers are administering the Act in different respects — the Minister administering the Act in the relevant respect,
if different Ministers are administering different portions of the Act — the Minister administering the relevant portion of the Act, or
if paragraphs (b) and (c) do not apply and 2 or more Ministers are administering that Act or a portion of that Act—any one of the Ministers administering the Act or portion of the Act.
[subs (2) am Act 94 of 1991 s 3 and Sch 1]
In any instrument, a reference to “the Minister” is a reference to:
the Minister administering the Act under which the instrument is made,
if different Ministers are administering that Act in different respects — the Minister administering that Act in the respect in relation to which the instrument is made,
if different Ministers are administering different portions of that Act — the Minister administering the portion of that Act under which the instrument is made, or

if paragraphs (b) and (c) do not apply and 2 more Ministers are administering that Act or a portion of that Act—any one of the Ministers administering the Act or the portion of the Act under which the instrument is made.
[subs (3) am Act 94 of 1991 s 3 and Sch 1]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,120] s 16 British subjects and aliens

p.text: In any Act or instrument:
a reference to a British subject, or to a natural-born or naturalised subject of Her Majesty or to any other similar expression, is a reference to:
an Australian citizen, or
any other person who would, had the relevant Commonwealth law continued in force, be a person who has the status of a British subject or the status of a British subject without citizenship, and
a reference to an alien is a reference to a person who would, had the relevant Commonwealth law continued in force, be a person who is an alien within the meaning of that law.
If a rule of law applies to or in relation to, or has effect with respect to, a British subject, the rule of law shall apply to or in relation to, or have effect with respect to:
an Australian citizen, and
any other person who would, had the relevant Commonwealth law continued in force, be a person who has the status of a British subject or the status of a British subject without citizenship,
as if the Australian citizen or other person were a British subject.

If a rule of law applies to or in relation to, or has effect with respect to, an alien, the rule of law shall apply to or in relation to, or have effect with respect to, a person who would, had the relevant Commonwealth law continued in force be a person who is an alien within the meaning of that law.
In this section, a reference to the relevant Commonwealth law is a reference to:
the Australian Citizenship Act 1948 of the Commonwealth , as in force immediately before the commencement of this subsection, and
the regulations in force immediately before the commencement of this subsection under the Australian Citizenship Act 1948 of the Commonwealth , as so in force.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,125] s 17 Public Seal of the State

p.text: In any Act or instrument, a reference to:
the Great Seal of the State, or
the Seal of the State,
shall be read as a reference to the Public Seal of the State.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,130] s 18 Sitting days

p.text: In any Act or statutory rule:
a reference to a sitting day, in relation to a House of Parliament, is a reference to a day on which the House actually sits, and

a reference to a number of sitting days, in relation to a House of Parliament, is a reference to that number of sitting days, regardless of whether those days occur within the same or within different sessions of Parliament.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,135] s 19 Holders of offices

p.text: In any Act or instrument, a reference to a particular officer or to the holder of a particular office includes a reference to the person for the time being occupying or acting in the office concerned.
The office of chairperson, chairman or chairwoman may be referred to by whichever of those words is appropriate in relation to the particular holder of that office.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,140] s 20 References to statutory rules etc

p.text: In any Act:
means a by-law made under the Act in which that word occurs.
means an ordinance made under the Act in which that word occurs.
means prescribed by, or by a statutory rule made under, the Act in which that word occurs.
means a regulation made under the Act in which that word occurs.
means a rule made under the Act in which that word occurs.

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,150] s 21A Construction of references in relation to the Public Service

leg:heading.title: Construction of references in relation to the Public Service

p.text: In any Act, in any instrument made under any Act or in any other instrument of any kind (enacted, made or executed whether before or after the commencement of this section):
a reference to the Public Service is to be read as a reference to the Public Service within the meaning of the Public Sector Employment and Management Act 2002, and
a reference to a public servant is to be read as a reference to a member of staff of a Department within the meaning of that Act, and
a reference to a Department Head is to be read as including a reference to a person who has the functions of a Department Head within the meaning of that Act.
[s 21A insrt Act 43 of 2002 s 169 and Sch 7, effective 9 September 2002]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,155] s 21B Construction of references in relation to the Government Service

leg:heading.title: Construction of references in relation to the Government Service

p.text: In any Act, in any instrument made under any Act or in any other instrument of any kind:
a reference to the Government Service is to be read as a reference to the Government Service within the meaning of the Public Sector Employment and Management Act 2002, and
a reference to a member of the Government Service is to be read as a reference to a member of staff of any Division of the Government Service.
[s 21B insrt Act 2 of 2006 s 7 and Sch 5, effective 17 March 2006]

leg:level-vrnt.toc-caption: [330,157] s 21C References to de facto partners and de facto relationships

leg:heading.title: References to de facto partners and de facto relationships

p.text: For the purposes of any Act or instrument, a person is the de facto partner of another person (whether of the same sex or a different sex) if:
the person is in a registered relationship or interstate registered relationship with the other person within the meaning of the Relationships Register Act 2010, or
the person is in a de facto relationship with the other person.
For the purposes of any Act or instrument, a person is in a de facto relationship with another person if:
they have a relationship as a couple living together, and
they are not married to one another or related by family.
A de facto relationship can exist even if one of the persons is legally married to someone else or in a registered relationship or interstate registered relationship with someone else.

In determining whether 2 persons have a relationship as a couple for the purposes of subsection (2), all the circumstances of the relationship are to be taken into account, including any of the following matters that are relevant in a particular case:
the duration of the relationship,
the nature and extent of their common residence,
whether a sexual relationship exists,
the degree of financial dependence or interdependence, and any arrangements for financial support, between them,
the ownership, use and acquisition of property,
the degree of mutual commitment to a shared life,
the care and support of children,
the performance of household duties,
the reputation and public aspects of the relationship.
No particular finding in relation to any of those matters is necessary in determining whether 2 persons have a relationship as a couple.
For the purposes of subsection (2), 2 persons are related by family if:
one is the child (including an adopted child) of the other, or
one is another descendant of the other (even if the relationship between them is traced through an adoptive parent), or
they have a parent in common (including an adoptive parent of either or both of them).
[subs (4) am Act 102 of 2010 Sch 2.4, effective 1 March 2011]
Subsection (4) applies:
even if an adoption has been declared void or is of no effect, and
to adoptions under the law of any place (whether in or out of Australia) relating to the adoption of children.
[subs (5) insrt Act 102 of 2010 Sch 2.4, effective 1 March 2011]

Subsection (4) applies in relation to a child whose parentage is transferred as a result of a parentage order, or an Interstate parentage order, within the meaning of the Surrogacy Act 2010 in the same way as it applies in relation to an adopted child, even if the parentage order is discharged or otherwise ceases to have effect. For that purpose, a reference in that subsection to an adoptive parent is to be read as a reference to a person to whom the parentage of a child is transferred under such a parentage order.
[subs (6) insrt Act 102 of 2010 Sch 2.4, effective 1 March 2011]
[s 21C insrt Act 19 of 2010 Sch 2.2, effective 19 May 2010]
